src:
Después de caer por goleada ante Flamengo, Corinthians despide a su técnico
04 Nov 2019, 00:02 by Sport.es

Bruno Henrique marcó un triplete
Corinthians se quedó con 45 puntos

Flamengo no quita el pie del acelerador y este domingo en el mítico Maracaná goleó 4-1 a Corinthians por la trigésima jornada del Brasileirao para consolidar su liderato.
Sin embargo del otro lado de la moneda aparece Corinthians, club que no ha tenido una buena temporada a pesar de estar en la séptima posición con 45 puntos, sin embargo, ligaban ocho juegos sin conseguir la victoria y la derrota de este domingo fue lo que colmó la paciencia de la directiva.
Los dirigentes anunciaron que el entrenador Fábio Carille dejó de ser técnico del “Timao” después haber logrado tres campeonatos regionales, el Brasileirao del 2018 y tras convertirse en el séptimo director con más partidos dirigidos en la historia de Corinthians, con un total de 183 juegos.
“Toda plática de renuncia es triste, pero aún más acerca de un entrenador que tiene una grande historia con el Corinthians. Tuvimos que tomar esta decisión”, confirmó Andrés Sánchez, director del club.
De forma interina para dirigir el juego del próximo miércoles ante Fortaleza estará Dyego Coelho. Cabe destacar que Tiago Nunes y Sylvinho son los principales candidatos para ocupar el nuevo puesto, aunque será en el transcurso de los siguientes días que la directiva anuncie su decisión.
text:
After falling for a win against Flamengo, Corinthians dismisses his coach
04 Nov 2019, 00:02 by Sport.es

Bruno Henrique marked a triplet
Corinthians got 45 points

Flamengo does not take his foot off the accelerator and this Sunday in the legendary Maracaná he beat Corinthians 4-1 for the thirtieth day of Brasileirao to consolidate his leadership.
However on the other side of the coin appears Corinthians, a club that has not had a good season despite being in seventh place with 45 points, however, they linked eight games without achieving victory and this Sunday's defeat was what The patience of the board was over.
The leaders announced that coach Fábio Carille stopped being a coach of “Timao & rdquor; after having won three regional championships, the 2018 Brazilian and after becoming the seventh director with more games directed in the history of Corinthians, with a total of 183 games.
“Every resignation talk is sad, but even more about a coach who has a great history with the Corinthians. We had to make this decision & rdquor ;, confirmed Andrés Sánchez, club director.
On an interim basis to direct the game next Wednesday against Fortaleza will be Dyego Coelho. It should be noted that Tiago Nunes and Sylvinho are the main candidates to fill the new position, although it will be during the following days that the board announces its decision.
